paper_abstract: Training of recurrent neural networks (RNNs) is known to be a very difficult task. This work proposes a novel constructive method for simultaneous structure and parameter training of Elman-type RNNs using a combination of particle swarm optimization (PSO) and covariance matrix adaptation based evolutionary strategy (CMA-ES). The proposed method allows the imposition of certain stability conditions, which can be maintained throughout the constructive process. The examples reported show a monotonic decrease in training error throughout the constructive process and also demonstrate the efficiency of the proposed method for structure and parameter training of RNNs. paper_title: Constructive training of recurrent neural networks using hybrid optimization
